title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: installation need remotes library. remotes available. package can installed using following code: load package:

title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: authentication token needed using Telraam API. one, can obtain one registering Telraam . obtained token, can set using following line code: Save token .Renviron file opened execute command restart session. can check see token loaded follows: authentication token can also provided mytoken argument functions call Telraam API.

title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: possible obtain camera instances registered server following code:
code: cameras_summary <- read_telraam_cameras()  cameras_summary |> str() ## tibble [7,939 × 19] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) ##  $ instance_id        : num [1:7939] 5641 6818 6927 3454 5729 ... ##  $ mac                : num [1:7939] 2.02e+14 3.50e+14 2.02e+14 2.02e+14 2.02e+14 ... ##  $ user_id            : num [1:7939] 6121 7287 3510 3751 6187 ... ##  $ segment_id         : num [1:7939] 9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 ... ##  $ direction          : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE FALSE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ status             : chr [1:7939] "stopped" "non_active" "stopped" "active" ... ##  $ manual             : logi [1:7939] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ... ##  $ time_added         : POSIXct[1:7939], format: "2022-07-08 16:33:42" "2023-04-03 18:43:54" ... ##  $ time_end           : POSIXct[1:7939], format: "2023-05-23 14:26:42" NA ... ##  $ last_data_package  : POSIXct[1:7939], format: "2023-05-23 14:25:50" "2023-06-17 07:30:08" ... ##  $ first_data_package : POSIXct[1:7939], format: "2022-07-08 16:34:10" "2023-04-03 18:45:09" ... ##  $ pedestrians_left   : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE FALSE FALSE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ pedestrians_right  : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ bikes_left         : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ bikes_right        : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ cars_left          : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ cars_right         : logi [1:7939] TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE TRUE ... ##  $ is_calibration_done: chr [1:7939] "yes" "no" "yes" "yes" ... ##  $ hardware_version   : num [1:7939] 1 2 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 NA ...

title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: obtain location network links .k.. segments, following function can used: following code show location segments using tmap library.
code: my_segments <- read_telraam_segments()  my_segments |> str() ## Classes 'sf' and 'data.frame':   6517 obs. of  2 variables: ##  $ oidn    : num  9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 9e+09 ... ##  $ geometry:sfc_MULTILINESTRING of length 6517; first list element: List of 1 ##   ..$ : num [1:5, 1:2] 3.3 3.3 3.3 3.3 3.3 ... ##   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr [1:3] "XY" "MULTILINESTRING" "sfg" ##  - attr(*, "sf_column")= chr "geometry" library(tmap) tmap_mode("view") tm_shape(my_segments) + tm_lines()

title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: hourly report single site can obtained using read_Telraam_traffic function. following code shows example use: function returns data set hourly traffic vehicle type direction include_speed set TRUE. returned data frame include binned speed distribution cars can visualise number cars per day using following code:

title: R Interface For The Telraam API
text: traffic data available, tidy_directional function can used formatting traffic data: new formatted data eases visualisations analysis direction. example, following code shows median car hourly-flow direction:
code: dir_data <- data |>   tidy_directional() ## Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.6.2, PROJ 9.2.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE dir_data ## # A tibble: 5,760 × 10 ##    segment_id uptime timezone      date       datetime              day    hr ##         <dbl>  <dbl> <chr>         <date>     <dttm>              <dbl> <int> ##  1 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  2 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  3 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  4 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  5 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  6 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  7 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  8 9000003890  0.762 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 07:00:00     6     7 ##  9 9000003890  0.764 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 08:00:00     6     8 ## 10 9000003890  0.764 Europe/London 2023-03-25 2023-03-25 08:00:00     6     8 ## # ℹ 5,750 more rows ## # ℹ 3 more variables: road_dir <chr>, type <chr>, flow <dbl> dir_data |>   filter(type == "car") |>   drop_na(date) |>   ggplot(aes(x = hr, y = flow, col = road_dir)) +   geom_line(aes(group = factor(date)), alpha = 0.2) +   stat_summary(     fun = median,     geom = "line",     linewidth = 1   ) +   facet_grid(. ~ road_dir) +   labs(x = "Hour", y = "Cars per hour") +   theme(legend.position = "none")

Get hourly traffic report — read_telraam_traffic
text: Function interface traffic API call

title: Get hourly traffic report — read_telraam_traffic
code: read_telraam_traffic(   id,   report = c("per-hour"),   time_start,   time_end,   tz = Sys.timezone(),   mytoken = get_telraam_token(),   include_speed = FALSE )

title: Get hourly traffic report — read_telraam_traffic
text: id segment (instance) identifier question (can found address segment Telraam website) report can "per-hour", resulting hourly aggregated traffic time_start beginning requested time interval time_end end requested time interval (note: time interval closed-open, end time included anymore request tz timezone, default value Sys.timezone() machine. provided time zone affected daylight saving time, conversion time might result NA values datetime clocks change. mytoken authentication token, previously set usethis::edit_r_environ() set_telraamToken function include_speed logical, car speed distribution included final data, FALSE default

title: Get hourly traffic report — read_telraam_traffic
text: data.frame traffic data

title: Get hourly traffic report — read_telraam_traffic
code: if (FALSE) { # Setting up the PAT Method 1 (Recommended): # 1. Run the following line usethis::edit_r_environ()  # 2. Add the following line:     telraam = "your token goes here" # 3. Restart your R session  # Setting up the PAT Method 2: my_token = readLines(con = "mytoken.txt",warn = FALSE)  # Using the function read_telraam_traffic(9000003890,                      time_start = "2023-03-25 07:00:00",                      time_end = "2023-03-30 07:00:00")  read_telraam_traffic(9000003890,                      time_start = "2023-03-25 07:00:00",                      time_end = "2023-03-30 07:00:00",                      include_speed = TRUE) }

title: telraamR 0.1.0
text: Added ‘set_telraam_token’ temporary authentication Added ‘read_telraam_cameras’ cameras API call Added ‘read_telraam_segments’ segments API call Added ‘read_telraam_traffic’ traffic API call Added ‘tidy_directional’
